title: VLOOKUP_CONNECTION
description: Performs a dynamic lookup through a specified connection and returns the value of a specified field from the first matching record in that connected object.
syntax: VLOOKUP_CONNECTION(connection_name, object_name, return_field_name, ...[matching_field_name, matching_field_value], additional_clause_optional) -> Object

parameters.name: connection_name
parameters.description: The name of the connection to use.

parameters.name: object_name
parameters.description: The name of the object to look up.

parameters.name: return_field_name
parameters.description: The name of the field whose value will be returned.

parameters.name: …matching_field_name
parameters.description: The name of the field used to match records.

parameters.name: …matching_field_value
parameters.description: The field value used as matching criteria.

parameters.name: additional_clause_optional
parameters.description: Additional query conditions for more precise filtering.

examples:
VLOOKUP_CONNECTION("Salesforce_Prod",
                   "Opportunity",
                   "Amount", 
                   "AccountId", Id)
-- Fetches the Amount field from the first Opportunity record in the "Salesforce_Prod" connection
-- where the Opportunity’s AccountId matches the current record’s Id.

VLOOKUP_CONNECTION("Salesforce_Prod", 
                   "Opportunity", 
                   "Amount", 
                   "AccountId", Id, 
                   "OwnerId", $User.Id, 
                   "FiscalYear = 2024")
-- Retrieves the Amount field from the first Opportunity record in the "Salesforce_Prod" connection
-- where:
-- AccountId matches the current record’s Id
-- OwnerId matches the current user’s Id ($User.Id)
-- FiscalYear equals 2024
